column4: ubuntu _is not_ debian .. you expect to break ubuntu by installing debian packages on it :)
what package was this? let's have a look
if it's this one http://packages.debian.org/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?searchon=names&version=all&exact=1&keywords=libfontconfig1 .. then it's not for ubuntu
well you can, but that won't normalize the APT database tho
then should I disinstall evrything with synaptic ?
well, try this command and post the errors you see in a pastebin, we'll see what can be done.  sudo aptitude install -f
try installing libfontconfi1 manually .. download it from http://packages.ubuntu.com

try installing libfontconfi1 manually .. download it from http://packages.ubuntu.com
